org.kitteh.irc.client.library

Interface ServerInfo


  • public interface ServerInfo
    Provides information about the server to which the client is connected. This information is primarily acquired via ISUPPORT.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CaseMapping getCaseMapping()
      Gets the casemapping for the server.
      int getChannelLengthLimit()
      Gets the maximum length of channel names.
      Map<Character,Integer> getChannelLimits()
      Gets the channel join limits.
      Map<Character,ChannelModeType> getChannelModes()
      Gets the channel modes available.
      List<Character> getChannelPrefixes()
      Gets the list of accepted channel prefixes.
      List<ChannelUserMode> getChannelUserModes()
      Gets the list of accepted channel user modes, such as op.
      String getNetworkName()
      Gets the name of this network.
      int getNickLengthLimit()
      Gets the maximum length of nicknames.
      String getServerAddress()
      Gets the server-stated address of the server.
      String getServerVersion()
      Gets the version of the IRCd.
      boolean isValidChannel(String name)
      Gets if a given string is a valid channel name according to the available server information.

    • Method Detail

      • getCaseMapping

        @Nonnull
CaseMapping getCaseMapping()
        Gets the casemapping for the server. By default CaseMapping.RFC1459
        Returns:
        the casemapping

      • getChannelLengthLimit

        int getChannelLengthLimit()
        Gets the maximum length of channel names.
        Returns:
        channel length limit or -1 if unknown

      • getChannelLimits

        @Nonnull
Map<Character,Integer> getChannelLimits()
        Gets the channel join limits.
        Returns:
        a map of channel prefixes to limits

      • getChannelModes

        @Nonnull
Map<Character,ChannelModeType> getChannelModes()
        Gets the channel modes available. If the server has not provided information on channel modes, the default specified by ChannelModeType.getDefaultModes() is used and returned here.
        Returns:
        a mapping of mode characters to their type

      • getChannelPrefixes

        @Nonnull
List<Character> getChannelPrefixes()
        Gets the list of accepted channel prefixes. If the server has not provided this information all four listed in the IRC spec are returned (#&!+).
        Returns:
        available channel prefixes

      • getChannelUserModes

        @Nonnull
List<ChannelUserMode> getChannelUserModes()
        Gets the list of accepted channel user modes, such as op. Modes are listed from most powerful to least powerful. If the server has not provided this information a default list of op (mode o for prefix @) and voice (mode v for prefix +) are returned.
        Returns:
        channel modes defining user status

      • getNetworkName

        @Nullable
String getNetworkName()
        Gets the name of this network.
        Returns:
        network name or null if unknown

      • getNickLengthLimit

        int getNickLengthLimit()
        Gets the maximum length of nicknames.
        Returns:
        nickname length limit or -1 if unknown

      • getServerAddress

        @Nullable
String getServerAddress()
        Gets the server-stated address of the server.
        Returns:
        the server's address or null if unknown

      • getServerVersion

        @Nullable
String getServerVersion()
        Gets the version of the IRCd.
        Returns:
        server version or null if unknown

      • isValidChannel

        boolean isValidChannel(@Nonnull
                       String name)
        Gets if a given string is a valid channel name according to the available server information.
        Parameters:
        name - potentially valid name
        Returns:
        true if valid according to the known info
